channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: BPJDet: Extended Object Representation for Generic Body-Part Joint Detection
item.description: In this paper, we focus on the joint detection of human body and its corresponding parts.

item.title: Individual Fairness in Bayesian Neural Networks
item.description: We study Individual Fairness (IF) for Bayesian neural networks (BNNs).

item.title: A Common Misassumption in Online Experiments with Machine Learning Models
item.description: Online experiments such as Randomised Controlled Trials (RCTs) or A/B-tests are the bread and butter of modern platforms on the web.

item.title: GCNH: A Simple Method For Representation Learning On Heterophilous Graphs
item.description: Yet, achievement of consistent GNN performance on heterophilous graphs remains an open research problem.

item.title: Deep Multiview Clustering by Contrasting Cluster Assignments
item.description: Then, a cluster-level CVCL strategy is presented to explore consistent semantic label information among the multiple views in the fine-tuning stage.

item.title: GeoLayoutLM: Geometric Pre-training for Visual Information Extraction
item.description: Additionally, novel relation heads, which are pre-trained by the geometric pre-training tasks and fine-tuned for RE, are elaborately designed to enrich and enhance the feature representation.

item.title: China and the U.S. produce more impactful AI research when collaborating together
item.description: Given AI's massive potential, as well as the fierce geopolitical tensions between the two nations, a number of policies have been put in place that discourage AI scientists from migrating to, or collaborating with, the other country.

item.title: Self-Supervised Adversarial Imitation Learning
item.description: We address this limitation by incorporating a discriminator into the original framework, offering two key advantages and directly solving a learning problem previous work had.

item.title: HabitatDyn Dataset: Dynamic Object Detection to Kinematics Estimation
item.description: HabitatDyn was created from the perspective of a mobile robot with a moving camera, and contains 30 scenes featuring six different types of moving objects with varying velocities.

item.title: EulerNet: Adaptive Feature Interaction Learning via Euler's Formula for CTR Prediction
item.description: EulerNet converts the exponential powers of feature interactions into simple linear combinations of the modulus and phase of the complex features, making it possible to adaptively learn the high-order feature interactions in an efficient way.

item.title: How Well Does the Metropolis Algorithm Cope With Local Optima?
item.description: Even with the optimal temperature (the only parameter of the MA), the MA optimizes most cliff functions less efficiently than simple elitist evolutionary algorithms (EAs), which can only leave the local optimum by generating a superior solution possibly far away.

item.title: Can SAM Count Anything? An Empirical Study on SAM Counting
item.description: Meta AI recently released the Segment Anything model (SAM), which has garnered attention due to its impressive performance in class-agnostic segmenting.

item.title: Better Sign Language Translation with Monolingual Data
item.description: Sign language translation (SLT) systems, which are often decomposed into video-to-gloss (V2G) recognition and gloss-to-text (G2T) translation through the pivot gloss, heavily relies on the availability of large-scale parallel G2T pairs.

item.title: ReCEval: Evaluating Reasoning Chains via Correctness and Informativeness
item.description: Multi-step reasoning ability is fundamental to many natural language tasks, yet it is unclear what constitutes a good reasoning chain and how to evaluate them.

item.title: Rethinking Benchmarks for Cross-modal Image-text Retrieval
item.description: The reason is that a large amount of images and texts in the benchmarks are coarse-grained.

item.title: DIN-SQL: Decomposed In-Context Learning of Text-to-SQL with Self-Correction
item.description: We study the problem of decomposing a complex text-to-sql task into smaller sub-tasks and how such a decomposition can significantly improve the performance of Large Language Models (LLMs) in the reasoning process.

item.title: FindVehicle and VehicleFinder: A NER dataset for natural language-based vehicle retrieval and a keyword-based cross-modal vehicle retrieval system
item.description: Natural language (NL) based vehicle retrieval is a task aiming to retrieve a vehicle that is most consistent with a given NL query from among all candidate vehicles.

item.title: Tree-structured Parzen estimator: Understanding its algorithm components and their roles for better empirical performance
item.description: Recent advances in many domains require more and more complicated experiment design.

item.title: On the Importance of Exploration for Real Life Learned Algorithms
item.description: The quality of data driven learning algorithms scales significantly with the quality of data available.

item.title: Balancing Simulation-based Inference for Conservative Posteriors
item.description: We show empirically that the balanced versions tend to produce conservative posterior approximations on a wide variety of benchmarks.

item.title: Missing Modality Robustness in Semi-Supervised Multi-Modal Semantic Segmentation
item.description: We create the first benchmark for semi-supervised multi-modal semantic segmentation and also report the robustness to missing modalities.

item.title: Generate your neural signals from mine: individual-to-individual EEG converters
item.description: An ideal individual-to-individual neural converter is expected to generate real neural signals of one subject from those of another one, which can overcome the problem of individual differences for cognitive and computational models.

item.title: VisFusion: Visibility-aware Online 3D Scene Reconstruction from Videos
item.description: Different from their works which sparsify voxels globally with a fixed occupancy threshold, we perform the sparsification on a local feature volume along each visual ray to preserve at least one voxel per ray for more fine details.

item.title: Picking Up Quantization Steps for Compressed Image Classification
item.description: The sensitivity of deep neural networks to compressed images hinders their usage in many real applications, which means classification networks may fail just after taking a screenshot and saving it as a compressed file.

item.title: Persistently Trained, Diffusion-assisted Energy-based Models
item.description: Maximum likelihood (ML) learning for energy-based models (EBMs) is challenging, partly due to non-convergence of Markov chain Monte Carlo. Several variations of ML learning have been proposed, but existing methods all fail to achieve both post-training image generation and proper density estimation.

item.title: Joint Token Pruning and Squeezing Towards More Aggressive Compression of Vision Transformers
item.description: Experiments on various transformers demonstrate the effectiveness of our method, while analysis experiments prove our higher robustness to the errors of the token pruning policy.

item.title: Self-Attention in Colors: Another Take on Encoding Graph Structure in Transformers
item.description: We introduce a novel self-attention mechanism, which we call CSA (Chromatic Self-Attention), which extends the notion of attention scores to attention _filters_, independently modulating the feature channels.

item.title: Can GPT-4 Perform Neural Architecture Search?
item.description: We investigate the potential of GPT-4~\cite{gpt4} to perform Neural Architecture Search (NAS) -- the task of designing effective neural architectures.

item.title: Automated Medical Coding on MIMIC-III and MIMIC-IV: A Critical Review and Replicability Study
item.description: Medical coding is the task of assigning medical codes to clinical free-text documentation.

item.title: SequeL: A Continual Learning Library in PyTorch and JAX
item.description: Continual Learning is an important and challenging problem in machine learning, where models must adapt to a continuous stream of new data without forgetting previously acquired knowledge.

item.title: Noisy Universal Domain Adaptation via Divergence Optimization for Visual Recognition
item.description: To transfer the knowledge learned from a labeled source domain to an unlabeled target domain, many studies have worked on universal domain adaptation (UniDA), where there is no constraint on the label sets of the source domain and target domain.

item.title: PED-ANOVA: Efficiently Quantifying Hyperparameter Importance in Arbitrary Subspaces
item.description: The recent rise in popularity of Hyperparameter Optimization (HPO) for deep learning has highlighted the role that good hyperparameter (HP) space design can play in training strong models.

item.title: MiniGPT-4: Enhancing Vision-Language Understanding with Advanced Large Language Models
item.description: To examine this phenomenon, we present MiniGPT-4, which aligns a frozen visual encoder with a frozen LLM, Vicuna, using just one projection layer.

item.title: Point-supervised Single-cell Segmentation via Collaborative Knowledge Sharing
item.description: This strategy achieves self-learning by sharing knowledge between a principal model and a very light-weight collaborator model.

item.title: CKBP v2: An Expert-Annotated Evaluation Set for Commonsense Knowledge Base Population
item.description: Populating Commonsense Knowledge Bases (CSKB) is an important yet hard task in NLP, as it tackles knowledge from external sources with unseen events and entities.

item.title: Causal Analysis of Customer Churn Using Deep Learning
item.description: Causal analysis of the churn model can predict whether a customer will churn in the foreseeable future and assist enterprises to identify effects and possible causes for churn and subsequently use that knowledge to apply tailored incentives.

item.title: Does Manipulating Tokenization Aid Cross-Lingual Transfer? A Study on POS Tagging for Non-Standardized Languages
item.description: This can for instance be observed when finetuning PLMs on one language and evaluating them on data in a closely related language variety with no standardized orthography.

item.title: Ellipsoid fitting with the Cayley transform
item.description: We introduce an algorithm, Cayley transform ellipsoid fitting (CTEF), that uses the Cayley transform to fit ellipsoids to noisy data in any dimension.

item.title: Towards replacing precipitation ensemble predictions systems using machine learning
item.description: We demonstrate the feasibility of generating realistic precipitation ensemble members on unseen higher resolutions.

item.title: Learning to Program with Natural Language
item.description: Therefore, we further propose the Learning to Program (LP) method to ask LLMs themselves to learn natural language programs from the training dataset of complex tasks and then use the learned program to guide inference.

item.title: Learning Cellular Coverage from Real Network Configurations using GNNs
item.description: Cellular coverage quality estimation has been a critical task for self-organized networks.

item.title: Safety Assessment of Chinese Large Language Models
item.description: To further promote the safe deployment of LLMs, we develop a Chinese LLM safety assessment benchmark.

item.title: Image-text Retrieval via preserving main Semantics of Vision
item.description: To address this issue, this paper presents a semantic optimization approach, implemented as a Visual Semantic Loss (VSL), to assist the model in focusing on an image's main content.

item.title: Revisiting Implicit Neural Representations in Low-Level Vision
item.description: Implicit Neural Representation (INR) has been emerging in computer vision in recent years.

item.title: Prompt-Learning for Cross-Lingual Relation Extraction
item.description: Experiments on WMT17-EnZh XRE also show the effectiveness of our Prompt-XRE against other competitive baselines.

item.title: Omni Aggregation Networks for Lightweight Image Super-Resolution
item.description: While lightweight ViT framework has made tremendous progress in image super-resolution, its uni-dimensional self-attention modeling, as well as homogeneous aggregation scheme, limit its effective receptive field (ERF) to include more comprehensive interactions from both spatial and channel dimensions.

item.title: Feature-compatible Progressive Learning for Video Copy Detection
item.description: Video Copy Detection (VCD) has been developed to identify instances of unauthorized or duplicated video content.

item.title: Censoring chemical data to mitigate dual use risk
item.description: The dual use of machine learning applications, where models can be used for both beneficial and malicious purposes, presents a significant challenge.

item.title: Effective Open Intent Classification with K-center Contrastive Learning and Adjustable Decision Boundary
item.description: In this paper, we introduce novel K-center contrastive learning and adjustable decision boundary learning (CLAB) to improve the effectiveness of open intent classification.

item.title: A geometry-aware deep network for depth estimation in monocular endoscopy
item.description: To address this issue, we introduce a gradient loss to penalize edge fluctuations ambiguous around stepped edge structures and a normal loss to explicitly express the sensitivity to frequently small structures, and propose a geometric consistency loss to spreads the spatial information across the sample grids to constrain the global geometric anatomy structures.
